intro: Linnaea borealis f. classica, commonly known as the twinflower, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the northern regions of North America and Eurasia. It is characterized by its distinctive pair of opposite, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically reaches a height of 10–20 cm and has small, glossy, dark green leaves. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Linnaea borealis f. classica is noted for its ornamental value and its role in supporting local pollinators.
